titleStmt.title: H. N. Congar to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1650

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1863-1867

body.p:
Department of State.
Bureau of Immigration,
Washington, October 14. 1865.
Sir,

Referring to a letter addressed to you from this Office on the 10th of August last, asking whether any steps have been taken by your State to invite Immigration into it, and the nature of such steps, I would most respectfully state, that this Bureau has failed to receive a reply to that letter, and that it would feel greatly obliged to you for an early response to its questions.

I am, Sir, &c
Your obedient Servant
H N Congar
Commissioner of Immigration.

To His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
